column4: I am using breezy.  Have an old dell with a Cirrus Logic CS4610/11
Accordning to ALSA, it is supported
lspci returns: 0000:00:0b.0 Multimedia audio controller: Cirrus Logic CS 4610/11 [CrystalClear SoundFusion Audio Accelerator]  (rev 01)
The sound icon shows audio muted - if I try to turn in on I get an error that it can't find the device
Error I get is: No volume control elements and / or devices found
ok, this is where it starts to drive me crazy - alsamixer isn't there
brand new install - only thing I have done is install the WMV support drivers
the error I get when I run alsamixer: alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such file or directory
says its already there: alsa-utils is already the newest version.
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Do you have alsa-utils installed? dpkg -l | grep alsa
- says alsa-base, utils, gstreamer0.8-also, libesd-alsa0 and plugins are there
My system has /usr/bin/alsamixer. You are saying you don't have that?
the actual error is: alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such file or directory
I have typed that in to Google.com to see if anyone else has had a similar problem.
I did some poking around. NOthing real conclusive. All I can say is, you need to do the same. That is what google is there to help you with.
- I know.  I have spent four hours on this.

Kind of weird, but sometimes you need to walk away from tough problems and stop thinking about them. Then come back and attack them the next day. Sometimes it makes the answer fall right in front of you. :)
